Reviews.Content: Big confortable rooms in modern setting I can heartily recommend this hotel. We take two adjoining rooms. Both were big, very big indeed, by European standards. Everything was spick-and-span. This is a well appointed hotel, reminiscent of the quality you find in some of the Asian capitals.
Reviews.Author: frank2007

Reviews.Content: Good Business, Poor Tourist... The hotel is in a good location with nice rooms - but is clearly geared toward the business traveler. The restaurant on premises is outrageous (21E for a sparse buffet), the front desk is very young - little knowledge of the Frankfurt area  no knowledge of the local tourist spots.
Reviews.Author: frankll1a

Reviews.Content: Positive Review!! My family stayed for two nights. The staff was great..... the room was huge... and accommodating, with a kitchette. Beautiful clean room, furniture.....and bedding. The wellness and Spa area was really nice.... clean and relaxing.Negative, the hotel is very tall and narrow, the elevators were always going in the wrong direction, and the staff neglected to mention that you have to use your swipe card. We had to change our room cards 3 times because they stopped working. No breakfast. And the path to the wellness center passes automated doors to the outside, for the business from outside, but, its not so great when your in a bathrobe, winter time!
Reviews.Author: TorontoTraveller38

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with outstanding service We spent only one night at Lindner Main Plaza, but it was a wonderfulexpierence. Huge rooms, more like suites with seperated living and sleeping area - huge bathroom with a tub and marble floors. The room was clean as a whistle and the the view is really amazing through the big windows over the city (window can be opened). Room service for breakfast is awesome and arrives on time. The breakfast was greatand worth the money. The only little drawback is that the mini bar isway overprized (Mini Water bottle 3.00 EURO) but there is a free water bottle in the room and a little grocery store right around the corner. We arrived by train and followed the directions on the linder. de website and it was only a 3 minute walk from the s-bahn station Lokalbahnhof. Very convenient. Also only a short walk througha park to get to the Zeil. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant but nearby (in the Colosseum) at an Indian Restaurant (MONSUN) right around the corner from the hotel entrance. Outstanding food!!! The next morning we used the Wellness area, which is included in the room price. There is a pool and lots of different Sauna's. Also a fitness room, which we didn't use. We also enjoyed the massage at theBeauty and Spa downstairs. Great expierence and they do have last minute prices (about 2/3 of the normal price for a massage). Overall it was enjoyment pure and we will defenately stay in this hotel again - the next time longer then one night.
Reviews.Author: michellec_26

Reviews.Content: Great views, greater wellness area! It's a great place to stay. Admittedly it's over the other side of the river and not that close to the financial district but then again it's only 10 minutes by taxi or 5-6 minutes by 鈥楽-Bahn鈥?plus a 7-8 minute walk to the station.The best about the place is the unusually shaped rooms. I stayed there 3 times altogether and each time it was grand. Rooms are huge and some are equipped with a little kitchenette. The only thing I disliked is that there鈥檚 no free Internet / WLAN. That should be included these days, especially, if you're paying close to rack rates. Round the corner you even find a supermarket open 鈥榯ill 10PM that also sells organic stuff, not too bad for a 2 minute walk away!The wellness area is also great: try the pool for a sunset 鈥?it's fab. There additionally is a sauna, steam room and a sanarium!For those jogging fans: just outside the hotel along the Rhine鈥檚 riverbank you can go about it to your hearts content!Brilliant place and entirely recommended!
Reviews.Author: London-Travella

Reviews.Content: 100% Recommend ! This hotel was fantastic ....we did a package weekend and also enjoyed the restaurant (fabulous food) the breakfast is amazing...the pool  sauna  steam room are a really nice way to relax...huge rooms....request room 5-2 if you can (5th floor) and it is GREAT ! (5th floor has a HUGE balcony, other floors don't seem to have this ! ) Very close to shopping too ! Contact me if you have more inquiries !
Reviews.Author: misscross2000

Reviews.Content: Service Problems It was my third visit in the hotel and beyond the rooms that are really spacious and very clean I was really dissapointed.The check in was too slow and although they had all my personal data they asked me to fill again the registration form .Although I paid in advance for my stay (my cc has been forwarded to them by email while booking) when I asked for room service they called me back telling me I have no credit so I must pay in cash (the cost of food was 32 euros ,while in the mean time I gave them a deposit of 300 euros).After I complained they called back telling me it was a mistake and when they brought the food (my Thai soup with prawns turned out to be a vegetable soup with one prawn )they offered me an extra refreshment free as an apologie.Of course I didn't accept it thinking in the meanwhile that they really need to train their employees on guest relation tacticks.The second day I checked with my office to find out that some documents I was waiting have been forwarded to the hotel but nobody ever delivered them to my room.Guess what? They had them in the reception and they said that as they could read only my first name they could not deliver them.Nice excuse but with the software they use (fidelio ) they can trace any room number by using only the first( or partial ) name.The same night a goup of ten people(after a long day at work ) the hotel we went to Harrys New York bar and it took them 45 minutes to prepare some sandwiches while the ones who ordered burgers had to wait 1 hour and fifteen minutes (as they call delivery from the city).I really think that the managment should care more about the service and that bad location (it's not in the center ) in combination with bad service is a terrible mix If you have to stay there try the Italian restaurant that is next to the hotel ( The Biancanali ) if you want to have a tasty dinner and service that respects you as a guest.
Reviews.Author: Haris N Neofitidis

Reviews.Content: Incredible room Spent a night in the Lindner Hotel during a recent business trip.The hotel is located a little outside the city center (15min by taxi) directly on the river Main.Rooms are in an old tower, some of them seem to be apartments for long-term stays.The room was one of the best I have ever had. Very spacious, window front with great view of the skyline of Frankfurt, sofa, small kitchen, huge bath with tub and shower. Not sure if all the rooms are like this, but this one was truly great.Breakfast was not up to the standard of german business hotels and the service was poor (had to wait for coffee until I was nearly finished). Not enough space to accomodate everyone on a private table.Spa is great. Pool very small, but the Saunas (3 different ones) are excellent and very clean.Overall very good value (paid 155 Euro) for the great room you get. If they can improve on the breakfast, this place will probably be one of the best for staying in Frankfurt.
Reviews.Author: SwissTravellerone

Reviews.Content: HUGE rooms Although I was in the smallest (cheapest) category, this was one of the largest hotel rooms I ever stayed at in Germany. Unfortunately, no skyline view, but good view over the Main river with a wide window sill to sit on. Windows open. Kitchenette with tea and coffee maker (not so common in German), fridge and some plates and cups. Very nice all-marble-bathroom with bathtub. Bathrobes available on request. Spa is in an extra pavillon, reached via a subterranean passage. Small pool, but refreshing in the morning. Breakfast room seemed a bit small, although on a Saturday morning at 10.30 a.m. we were the only guests ... Not extremely central, but then Frankfurt is small. No tram or underground (subway) stop very close, but still in walking distance.My new favorite hotel in Frankfurt! Maybe more suited for a private visit than for business. Would be great for a romantic city weekend.
Reviews.Author: Gernereiserin

Reviews.Content: A hotel for extended stays We stayed twice in this hotel (April and May) because it offers spacious serviced rooms with a fully equipped kitchenette while being in Frankfurt for business. Rates are attractive for extended stays. The rooms offer spectacular views of the Frankfurt skyline and the hotel is located at the Mainz river bank, close to the museums. Although it is not downtown, downtown can easily be reached by S-Bahn (a 5 minutes walk on the Siemensstrasse to Lokalbahnhof). Staff is attentive. Underground parking is 鈧?15. The inside swimming pool does not really invite for swimming because it is too small.
Reviews.Author: mundus

Reviews.Content: A nice modern hotel near the river       Night view from room
Reviews.Author: Sancarlo

Reviews.Content: Stunning views We spent a weekend in Frankfurt and because of the good deal they offered, we decided to stay at the Lindner Plaza. It is situated at the southern bankline of the Main river. The check in was fast, efficient and friendly. The elevator can only be used with a card.The room was actually a suite with an elegant seating area, a small diningplace and a kitchenette with minibar. The room was designed in warm colors. The bed was of kingsize and cosy. The extra pillows I've been asking for at the reservation were on their places.The staff were very friendly, efficient and catering our every need.We had breakfast at the restaurant The Brick, which was included by the roomrate. Also we joined the place for lunch and dinner, as we were more than satisfied with both, food and service.We only had to pay 118 Euro per night for the first class room at a special offer for the weekend. The late check out (at 6 p.m.) only 40 Euro extra.And best of all: the spectacular views of the frankfirt skyline. I will not forget this place for a long time.
Reviews.Author: AndreasHamburg

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel but poor air conditioning The hotel itself is very nice with only a few rooms per floor (20+ floors). One drawback is that the air conditioning is really a fan even though a thermostat is in the room. The staff indicated that they do not have American-style air conditioning - this could be a problem in the hot months. The room is very well decorated with modern furnishings and clean. Soundproofing is above average, although with the windows open you may hear traffic or trains on nearby bridges. The bathroom is above average size with marble tiles. Windows are very large. A nice plus is the kitchen in the room - a fridge, stove, microwave, utensils, etc. are provided. Elevators require a key card.The hotel is located right on the river, but a kilometer or so from downtown (across the bridge). Service was generally good. I didn't use the spa, but it looked nice. A grocery store and a couple of restaurants are within a 1-2 minute walk from the hotel.I would stay here again, but not in the hotter months.
Reviews.Author: NTraveler

Reviews.Content: The best one in town I stayed at Main Plaza 38 times in 2004 and about 20 times in 2003! Before I tried other Frankfurt hotels like Steigenberger, Maritim, Frankfurter Hof etc. but Main Plaza is the best:1. Friendly staffManagement has changed, but staff always friendly and helpful2. Great roomNew Design furniture, very large room, everything very expensive3. Impressive buldingDirectly at the river Main. Round architecture with more than 15 floors.4. Located near Sachsenhausen (Restaurants, Bars, Pubs).
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: really good Although a bit from the centre, but you can walk beautifully besides the mainz towards the centre! The Hotel is new and very modern. The rooms are really spacious. We had rooms on high floors so the view was al over Frankfurt. The rooms are very complete, even a kitchenette! Very nice bathroom, magazines are as well in the room. An Highclass hotel, but a little bit expensive when not in low season. We also enjoyed the pool, sauna, and stuff. It was inclusive of the price.The location of the hotel is near the river Mainz and the stroll along that is very nice and will bring you in no time in the centre of Frankfurt.I surely recommend it. Mind the prices of the hotel parking and the price of breakfast!
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
